alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Muscogee; Talbot (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Marion, Muscogee, Chattahoochee, southwestern Talbot and southern Harris Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 411 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Bartletts Ferry Dam to near Cataula to near Shiloh, and moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Cusseta, Waverly Hall, Geneva, Fort Moore, North Fort Moore, Bibb City, Upatoi, Ellerslie, Laurel Hills, Green Island Hills, Juniper, Vista Terrace, Cataula, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Baughville, Rose Hill, Oakland, Eelbeck/West Fort Moore and Benning Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
